newsitem.title: CANADA: WCE canola ends up on fund, commission buying, CBT.
newsitem.headline: WCE canola ends up on fund, commission buying, CBT.

text.p: WCE canola futures ended up on fund and commission house buying as Cargill sold, as well as spillover support from substantial gains in CBOT soy complex futures, traders said.

"RRC-DS bought. Funds bought early and Cargill sold 200 March and 400 May, there was some hedge selling," a trader said. Mar-May spread at $0.50. January futures crush profit margin rose to -35.60 from -35.88 on Tuesday. Volume was 4,255 lots, or 85,100 tonnes, with 360 hedge lots.
January canola rose $4 to $400, March up $2.50 to $400.50. March flax rose $2 to $350 on commercial demand. Jan-Mar spread at $3.50.

February western barley rose $0.10 to close at $134.60 on commission demand met by market-on-close hedges, May rose $0.40 to $134.10. PCTS sold the Feb-May spread at $0.50 to RBC-DS, traders said. Volume was 500 lots.
March feed wheat rose $2.50 to $168 as LFG bought late, May up $1.30 to $165.80. Volume was 115 lots.
The Wheat Pools sold 25 October feed peas up US$2.60 to US$186.40 to commercials, a trader said.
(All values in Canadian dollars/tonne except peas, oats)
